textRegions.text: Internal coordinate space for a view
Internal coordinate space for a view
Size is usually same as bounds
Internal coordinate space for a view
Size is usually same as bounds
A view should never care about its own frame!
Defines what regions should resize with the superview
Resizable width, fixed height and position
Fixed size, distance from top, centered
Seriously, what is Cocoa supposed to do here?
Only sort of works. Not great.
Can’t position relative to sibling views
Have to call -sizeToFit manually when content changes

“Tell me what layout you want;
I’ll worry about finding the 
right frame”

-Cocoa

Cocoa will set the frame based on constraints
Update the constraints, don’t set the frame

Update the constraints, don’t set the frame
Some views have a natural size

Migrating XIBs
Auto Layout is set for the whole document
Audit the XIB when you turn on Auto Layout
Migrating Code
-translatesAutoresizingMaskToConstraints
-default is YES for views created in code

When translatesAutoresizingMask… is YES
Constraints are automatically generated
The view resizes just like under Springs and Struts
Automatic constraints are updated whenever frame changes
However…
intrinsicContentSize is overridden by required constraints
